body:
It looks like the duplicacy team are making progress with this.

Is this good enough do you think or do you think I should change rclone too?

Hi @ncw 

that's a very good question :)

I have done some performance test, however are not giving the behaviour I was expecting, very low upload ratio (see latest update at [Rclone webdav Storage path test/ does not exist]( https://forum.duplicacy.com/t/rclone-webdav-storage-path-test-does-not-exist/1821/10)) but to be honest, I do not know if the issue is from rclone or duplicacy.

I have made test and I can only upload data on Kb... 

`Uploaded chunk 28 size 4776790, 757KB/s 01:59:11 1.7%
`

Using the rclone mount, I was uploading at 5 or 6 MB/s. I have done tests in at least four different storage providers with more or less same result in upload bandwidth.


rclone setup:

`/usr/bin/rclone serve webdav oDroidOpenDriveNative:/Test/newapproach --addr localhost:9491 --htpasswd /root/htpass --no-modtime -v --cache-dir /mnt/cache/opendrive --vfs-cache-max-age 1m --vfs-cache-mode full`

duplicacy command:
`duplicacy -v backup -stats -threads 30 -storage “openDrive_webdav”
`

Did you have to use `--vfs-cache-mode full`?

Did you get an error on the default?

I'd recommend either leaving it off, or using `--vfs-cache-mode writes`

What sort of speeds to you get if you just use a local directory `/tmp/backup` say rather than `oDroidOpenDriveNative:/Test/newapproach`?

good point @ncw !! 

too many variable I guess...

I decided to setup cache due to below message repeatedly showed:
`webdav root 'Test/newapproach': Target remote doesn't support streaming uploads, creating temporary local FS to spool file`

There is something I have noticed that makes a lot of improvement (mounting OpenDrive for instance)
 `   --write-back-cache    Makes kernel buffer writes before sending them to rclone. Without this, writethrough caching is used.`

However I cannot compare it with webdav as this option is not supported in webdav. Can you enable this option in webdav? (not sure it that makes sense)


Summarizing as per your request, 

- local works at 15Mbs. (Uploaded chunk 9 size 5396789, 13.84MB/s 00:06:23 1.5%)
- enabling cache with write, similar as full (Uploaded chunk 70 size 13219333, 1.37MB/s 00:57:19 12.4%)
- disabling cache, similar as full (Uploaded chunk 26 size 7003554, 1.40MB/s 01:01:37 3.7%)

 I made a lot of tests, with similar behaviour does not matter the cache (full or write).

I have seen a lot differences in how duplicacy writes when in remote (directly connecting to b2 storage for instance that uploads the file and finish) or in local (I share the remotes by rclone mount option and then duplicacy uploads a temporary file and then rename it, so two operations for rclone), that's why I started requesting the collaboration to make an API work, so the behaviour of duplicacy can be under control.

Basically (I am not blaming duplicacy of course)  [duplicacy is adding features](https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/bb652d0a8c7e89e9f0d4cb8acef7fdc453e21a6b) (thing that I really appreciate) however, those are causing some issues on the uploads through rclone.

> However I cannot compare it with webdav as this option is not supported in webdav. Can you enable this option in webdav? (not sure it that makes sense)

This is effectively `--vfs-cache-mode writes`, though I guess it isn't exactly equal as rclone will not return until the writeback is complete normally :-(

I suspect that the problem is that duplicacy is doing lots of operations, which rclone is in turn mirroring to the remote.  Each operation has latency.

Wheras when you are using `rclone mount` the kernel is doing lots of buffering for you.

Can you get duplicacy to increase its concurrency?  That will help with the latency.

Can you post a log from rclone with `-vv` of duplicacy doing a backup run (it will probably be quite big!) and we can have a go at analysing exactly what duplicacy is doing and why it might be slow.

I am sorry for the bit delay on my reply.

I did something even better :)

I have captured two situations for you.

1.  Mounting a remote openDrive share on local and try to backup (commands and output are in the zip file). Final result is cancelled due to an upload error, and upload speed from duplicacy is 1.8 mb... , real network statistics shows more or less the same.
If you try to backup with duplicacy in local, it creates a file with 8 random chars + .tmp as name and then renames this file when it is written. That causes, when using rclone mount, a lot of failures and retries, [as it is explained here...](https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/issues/550#issuecomment-469646031) I have managed to update a local copy of the duplicacy code (OMG so sorry about that!) and I have removed this renaming procedure which has made a backup of 40 hours to work continuously. 
For our (this) test I have used the compiled binary without this code removed. Maybe you can investigate on that to improve the backups mounted through rclone in local by duplicacy ( I consider this renaming code a bit problematic, even when I absolutely understand the creator wants a reliable write,  that is why I have opened the issue with duplicacy, however, no answer yet :(  ). 
[log_rclone_mount.zip](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/2984483/log_rclone_mount.zip)


2. Sharing through "_rclone serve webdav_" and performing the same backup test.
[log_rclone_webdav.zip](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/2984504/log_rclone_webdav.zip)
The size of logs is very different, bigger on the "local" backup.
Backup lasted for 12 mins with webdav, when it is suppose to take 1 or 2 mins to upload 1Gb at full speed (200Mb upload speed bandwidth)
Test was made with 1Gb of data, cache folder is in a SSD disk, data for backup is in spinning disk.


I have noticed also openDrive speed is very low compared with others, does not matter if its through rclone native or webdav setup (then you have the limitation of connections which must be less than 30 concurrent connections, otherwise you receive webdav error "Maximum backoff reached" and no uploads are performed).

Hi @ncw , apologizes for coming back to you again,  promise I won't make a habit of it.

This issue comes from [how duplicacy encrypts the content](https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/issues/224):

_

> I forgot that snapshots on an encrypted storage can't be easily renamed, because the snapshot files are encrypted with keys derived from their paths, so once they are renamed they can't be decrypted.

_


Now jottaCloud integration works flawless, I have tried to return to the approach of configuring duplicacy through rclone serve webdav in jotta repository, however, I have realized both (duplicacy and rclone) are now including an additional trailing / that makes the repository un-useful.

an example:

on version v1.45-069-g7ee7bc87-beta (last I had working with the old jotta validation), duplicacy is able to access webdav-http on / ([Please, see](https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/2b56d576c7ac192d8fefa512b91840f85c79f61e)) 

Now I am trying to configure exactly the same, and it does not work receiving the error  on duplicacy : 
Failed to load the WebDAV storage at webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094: Storage path  does not exist




Below an example with old and new version:

Working
```
root@datadroid:/usr/local/bin# rclone.good  serve webdav --config /root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf.bueno oDroid-Jottaold:dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav --no-modtime --checksum --addr l
ocalhost:9094 --htpasswd /root/htpass -v -v --transfers 6
2019/05/30 11:33:35 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.45-069-g7ee7bc87-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone.good" "serve" "webdav" "--config" "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf.bueno" "oDroid-Jottaold:dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav" "--no-modtime" "--checksum" "--addr" "localhost:9094" "--htpasswd" "/root/htpass" "-v" "-v" "--transfers" "6"]
2019/05/30 11:33:35 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf.bueno"
2019/05/30 11:33:36 INFO  : jottacloud root 'dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav': poll-interval is not supported by this remote
2019/05/30 11:33:36 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/forget" to remote control registry
2019/05/30 11:33:36 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/refresh" to remote control registry
2019/05/30 11:33:36 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/poll-interval" to remote control registry
2019/05/30 11:33:36 INFO  : Using "/root/htpass" as htpasswd storage
2019/05/30 11:33:36 NOTICE: jottacloud root 'dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav': WebDav Server started on http://127.0.0.1:9094/


2019/05/30 11:33:46 DEBUG : /: Stat:
2019/05/30 11:33:46 DEBUG : /: >Stat: fi={FileInfo:/}, err = <nil>
2019/05/30 11:33:46 DEBUG : /: OpenFile: flags=0, perm=----------
2019/05/30 11:33:46 DEBUG : /: OpenFile: flags=O_RDONLY, perm=----------
2019/05/30 11:33:46 DEBUG : /: >OpenFile: fd=/ (r), err=<nil>
2019/05/30 11:33:46 DEBUG : /: >OpenFile: err = <nil>
2019/05/30 11:33:46 INFO  : /: PROPFIND from 127.0.0.1:48658
2019/05/30 11:33:46 DEBUG : /snapshots: Mkdir: perm=-rwxrwxrwx
2019/05/30 11:33:47 DEBUG : /snapshots: >Mkdir: err = <nil>
2019/05/30 11:33:47 INFO  : /snapshots: MKCOL from 127.0.0.1:48658
2019/05/30 11:33:47 DEBUG : /chunks: Mkdir: perm=-rwxrwxrwx
2019/05/30 11:33:47 DEBUG : /chunks: >Mkdir: err = <nil>
2019/05/30 11:33:47 INFO  : /chunks: MKCOL from 127.0.0.1:48662
^C

root@datadroid:/data/isos# duplicacy -v   add -e -c 8M -max 16M -min 4M -copy "jottaCloud_rclone_data" --bit-identical   jottaCloud_webdav  data webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094
Enter the WebDAV password:XXYYZZ
Enter storage password for webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094:
Failed to read the password: interrupted
```

I cancel it, since it is reading the repository as it is asking for storage password.


now the new version where it does not work as expected:

```
root@datadroid:/usr/local/bin# rclone serve webdav oDroid-Jotta:dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav --no-modtime --checksum --addr localhost:9094 --htpasswd /root/htpass -v -v --transfers 62019/05/30 11:34:47 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.47.0-088-g11264c4f-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "serve" "webdav" "oDroid-Jotta:dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav" "--no-modtime" "--checksum" "--addr" "localhost:9094" "--htpasswd" "/root/htpass" "-v" "-v" "--transfers" "6"]
2019/05/30 11:34:47 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2019/05/30 11:34:48 INFO  : jottacloud root 'dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav': poll-interval is not supported by this remote
2019/05/30 11:34:48 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/forget" to remote control registry
2019/05/30 11:34:48 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/refresh" to remote control registry
2019/05/30 11:34:48 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/poll-interval" to remote control registry
2019/05/30 11:34:48 INFO  : Using "/root/htpass" as htpasswd storage
2019/05/30 11:34:48 NOTICE: jottacloud root 'dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav': WebDav Server started on http://127.0.0.1:9094/
2019/05/30 11:35:12 DEBUG : /: Stat:
2019/05/30 11:35:12 DEBUG : /: >Stat: fi={FileInfo:/}, err = <nil>
2019/05/30 11:35:12 DEBUG : /: OpenFile: flags=0, perm=----------
2019/05/30 11:35:12 DEBUG : /: OpenFile: flags=O_RDONLY, perm=----------
2019/05/30 11:35:12 DEBUG : /: >OpenFile: fd=/ (r), err=<nil>
2019/05/30 11:35:12 DEBUG : /: >OpenFile: err = <nil>
2019/05/30 11:35:12 INFO  : /: PROPFIND from 127.0.0.1:48676


root@datadroid:/data/isos# duplicacy -v add -e -c 8M -max 16M -min 4M -copy "jottaCloud_rclone_data" --bit-identical   jottaCloud_webdav  data webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094

Enter the WebDAV password:XXXYYYZZZ
Failed to load the WebDAV storage at webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094: Storage path  does not exist
```


In this case I receive the error: **Storage path  does not exist**

I have tried adding (and removing) a trailing / in both rclone (oDroid-Jotta:dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav & oDroid-Jotta:dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav/) and duplicacy configs (webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094 & webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094/) , with no luck, always receiving the error about path does not exist.

I could share the parent folder (dataDroid/duplicacy) and configure duplicacy to use the sub-folder (through http://iguana@localhost:9094:/newapproach_webdav/, in this case it works) however, I guess it is cleaner if we just share the full folder in rclone (/dataDroid/duplicacy/newapproach_webdav )and configure webdav-http on / (webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9094/)

what do you think?

> Now jottaCloud integration works flawless, I have tried to return to the approach of configuring duplicacy through rclone serve webdav in jotta repository, however, I have realized both (duplicacy and rclone) are now including an additional trailing / that makes the repository un-useful.

I don't understand exactly what you mean.  Where is the trailing '/' in your logs above?

Are you saying since v1.45-069-g7ee7bc87-beta that something has broken `rclone serve webdav` for duplicacy?  There haven't been any code updates on the rclone side but I did update the webdav library I'm using so that could be it in 613a9bb86b8b0f6837593a8ae87b638866e57552

Apologizes if I did not express myself correctly :-)

Well, I cannot assure there is a trailing / (I already had a discussion [on this regards here](https://github.com/gilbertchen/duplicacy/commit/2b56d576c7ac192d8fefa512b91840f85c79f61e) and you replied on:

> Basically when Duplicacy looked for a path like storage/ , the webdav implementation in rclone returned information about storage (with the trailing slash removed), so Duplicacy thought the path doesn’t exist.

I was wondering whether that had any relationship, maybe not.

Unfortunately, you are right :) I cannot see the diference (after enabling debug mode in both) however, the error is very clear:

* Using latest beta, I receive the error:
Failed to load the WebDAV storage at webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9093/: Storage path  does not exist
* Using version 1.45, I am able to see the repository content.

Repeating the test....
That is the common log in both versions attempting to read the repository (duplicacy  -v -d list -storage "jottaCloud_rclone_webdav_data") :
```
2019/06/03 23:29:04 DEBUG : /: Stat:
2019/06/03 23:29:04 DEBUG : /: >Stat: fi={FileInfo:/}, err = <nil>
2019/06/03 23:29:04 DEBUG : /: OpenFile: flags=0, perm=----------

2019/06/03 23:29:04 DEBUG : /: >OpenFile: err = <nil>
2019/06/03 23:29:04 INFO  : /: PROPFIND from 127.0.0.1:47560
```


this is the log on rclone (-vvv) when using the 1.45 version (it shows as above info and also):

```

2019/06/03 23:44:23 INFO  : /snapshots/data/: PROPFIND from 127.0.0.1:47710
```



in both cases I use the same modifiers, the only difference is the rclone version:

* 1.45) /usr/bin/rclone serve webdav dRock-JottaCNew:Duplicacy/dataRock64-data  --addr localhost:9093  --htpasswd /root/htpass  -vvv

* latest) /usr/bin/rclone.good serve webdav dRock-Jottaold:Duplicacy/dataRock64-data  --addr localhost:9093  --htpasswd /root/htpass  -vvv


Not sure then if with the new validation against Jotta, they have changed how the files are requested (of course I am not blaming anyone :)), Just stating it works with the old version.

Thanks for your reply and sorry for the delay.

> 2019/06/03 23:29:04 INFO  : /: PROPFIND from 127.0.0.1:47560

Can you use tcpdump/wireshark to see what duplicacy sends and what rclone responds with at this point? If you can do the current and the 1.45 versions then that should show us what has changed hopefully!

Hi @ncw ,
of course I can, I am very glad to help to identify the issue.

I am attaching a file which contains two files for both tests. One is the .pcap file of tcpdump captures and the other is the txt with both rclone and duplicacy output.

[webdav_issue.tar.gz](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/3259427/webdav_issue.tar.gz)

It is included in the txt file the content of the rclone.conf file for both setups (I have recreated the setup in the v1.47 test (just in case). 

The only difference I have noticed is that in the new version (v1.47), there is no reference to "mountpoint = Archive" as I had in the old setup, however that should not interfere as when I use "rclone mount" it works like a charm mounting and I can correctly access the files.

Again, thanks so much for your review and help. I really appreciate it.

PS: I have made another test in another system for your reference, please, find the file attached below those lines.... I have removed any reference to pass or usernames...

[webdav_issue_dataDroid.tar.gz](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/3259448/webdav_issue_dataDroid.tar.gz)

Hi again,

I did not have time to review the .pcap files yesterday night, I finish late doing the tests. Today, I have taken a look and the only difference I see on the captures are on the  number 4 packet (PROPFIND), 

v.1.45)

> <D:response>
>     **<D:href>
>         /
>         </D:href>**
>     <D:propstat>


v.1.47) (trailing "/" ?)

> <D:response>
>     **<D:href>
>         //
>         </D:href>**
>     <D:propstat>
> 

in the same capture, on v.1.47 the response does not continue..
```
   [HTTP response 1/1]
    [Time since request: 0.011185000 seconds]
***    [Request in frame: 4]
    [Request URI: http://localhost:9093/]
    File Data: 395 bytes
```


but in the v.1.45, the response continue on frame 10...
```
   [HTTP response 1/3]
   [Time since request: 0.031591000 seconds]
***    [Request in frame: 4]
***    [Next response in frame: 10]
    [Request URI: http://localhost:9093/]
    File Data: 394 bytes
```
that are the differences I can see on the captures.

Thank you for the captures and the analysis, very useful.

Hmm, that trailing `/` looks very suspicious.

The request for that was

```
PROPFIND / HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:9093
User-Agent: Go-http-client/1.1
Content-Length: 120
Authorization: Basic XXX
Content-Type: application/xml
Depth: 0
Accept-Encoding: gzip
```

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<propfind xmlns="DAV:">
    <prop>
        <getcontentlength/>
        <resourcetype/>
    </prop>
</propfind>
```

And the response was

```
HTTP/1.1 207 Multi-Status
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8
Date: Wed, 05 Jun 2019 23:36:55 GMT
Content-Length: 395
```

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<D:multistatus xmlns:D="DAV:">
    <D:response>
        <D:href>//</D:href>
        <D:propstat>
            <D:prop>
                <D:resourcetype>
                    <D:collection xmlns:D="DAV:"/>
                </D:resourcetype>
            </D:prop>
            <D:status>HTTP/1.1 200 OK</D:status>
        </D:propstat>
        <D:propstat>
            <D:prop>
                <D:getcontentlength>
                </D:getcontentlength>
            </D:prop>
            <D:status>HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found</D:status>
        </D:propstat>
    </D:response>
</D:multistatus>
```

I just checked the changelog of the upstream project and it looks like an additional / was introduced here: https://github.com/golang/go/issues/29858

Please try this fix where I have patched the upstream library.  If this works then I'll work on getting the patch merged upstream.

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.47.0-099-gaf7e0652-fix-3002-webdav-slash-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Brilliant!!! 

it worked like a charm :)
```
# duplicacy list -storage "jottaCloud_rclone_webdav_data"
Storage set to webdav-http://iguana@localhost:9093/
Snapshot data revision 1 created at 2019-05-22 01:19 -hash
Snapshot data revision 2 created at 2019-05-27 22:14
```

and the log from rclone side...

```
2019/06/06 15:45:41 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.47.0-099-gaf7e0652-fix-3002-webdav-slash-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone-v1.47.0-099-gaf7e0652-fix-3002-webdav-slash-beta-linux-arm64/rclone" "serve" "webdav" "dRock-JottaC:/Duplicacy/dataRock64-data" "--addr" "localhost:9093" "--htpasswd" "/root/htpass" "-vvv"]
2019/06/06 15:45:41 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2019/06/06 15:45:41 DEBUG : dRock-JottaC: Loaded invalid token from config file - ignoring
2019/06/06 15:45:41 DEBUG : dRock-JottaC: Saved new token in config file
2019/06/06 15:45:42 INFO  : jottacloud root 'Duplicacy/dataRock64-data': poll-interval is not supported by this remote
2019/06/06 15:45:42 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/forget" to remote control registry
2019/06/06 15:45:42 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/refresh" to remote control registry
2019/06/06 15:45:42 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/poll-interval" to remote control registry
2019/06/06 15:45:42 INFO  : Using "/root/htpass" as htpasswd storage
2019/06/06 15:45:42 NOTICE: jottacloud root 'Duplicacy/dataRock64-data': WebDav Server started on http://127.0.0.1:9093/
```


thanks so much @ncw , you are always very helpful. For things like that I never regret supporting all of you to "buy flowers (and other pretty things)" :) and I appreciate being your beta tester.

You Rock!!
Excellent!  I'll work on an upstream patch and when it is merged I'll pull it back into rclone.

Just discovered someone has already reported this: https://github.com/golang/go/issues/31983

And made a fix: https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/net/+/176737

So hopefully it will get merged soon.

issue.title: webdav: remove redundant trailing slash for root directory
